live_warning.title: Recording in Progress
live_warning.description: This recording is still in progress. Processing the recording now will give you a partial export of the audio recorded so far.

delete_modal.header: Are you sure you want to delete this recording?
delete_modal.subtext: This action is IRREVERSABLE and nobody can help you get it back.
delete_modal.delete_key_invalid: The delete key you provided is invalid.
delete_modal.delete_key_hint: Your delete key can be found in your DMs or when running the {command} command.

download.active_download_description: A download is currently being processed, and must be finished before downloading again.
download.no_users_description: No users are in this recording yet. People are added into the recording when they speak. Check the recording panel to confirm when someone is in the recording. If there are issues, switch the voice region or restart the recording.

wdiu.name: Which do I use?
wdiu.content:
Buttons under Multi-track will export your recording in a ZIP file with each track, or sound file, having each persons voice in it, already synced up to each other.

Buttons under Single-track will merge all those tracks into one file.

If you want an easy way to edit your audio, you can install and use {audacity} (or any forks of it) and download the Audacity Project format.

If you are an Apple user, you may want to use the {aac} format.

In all other cases, {flac} is a widely supported format that will work best for you.

modal.subtext: Your download will be given in the form of a {file} file.

description.project: This file is intended to be used with the {software} software. In order to open this file, extract all contents of the ZIP file and open the project by clicking the {file} file.
description.zip: Users audio tracks are separated into {file} files.
description.mix: All audio tracks are mixed into a single {file} file.
description.executable: Craig will create a portable executable where your audio will be packed into. Running the executable will allow you to process the audio data however you'd like. Note that as this executable is not signed, it may give false positives to anti-virus programs.
description.script: Craig will create an audio processor script that allows you to process your audio however you'd like. Extract the contents of the ZIP file before running the script.
description.linux_script: Craig will create an audio processor script that allows you to process your audio however you'd like. Extract the contents of the ZIP file before running the script. You will need to have FFMpeg installed on your device.
description.raw: This downloads the raw.dat file that is usually included with every multi-track download. This is the raw Opus data received by Craig. Most audio programs may not properly support this.
description.infotxt: This downloads the info.txt file that is usually included with every multi-track download. This gives general information about the recording.
description.transcription_txt: This makes a plain text transcription file for everyone in the recording. Each line says the speaker's name along with the line they spoke in order.
description.transcription_vtt: This makes a WebVTT transcription file for everyone in the recording. This also includes per-word timings for each speaker. WebVTT is a widely supported format for modern software.
description.transcription_srt: This makes a SubRip Text transcription file for everyone in the recording. SubRip Text (or SRT) is a widely supported format.

modal.runpod_warn: We use {runpod} to handle processing transcriptions using {whisper}. You may be subject to their terms.

ennuizel_modal.description: Buttons that have a red border use audio processing in your browser using Ennuizel. Depending on your browser, it may be unsupported or take up a good amount of RAM to process your recording. If you have any problems, choose a different format.

avatar_zip.button_description: Get the avatars of all participants of this recording in a ZIP file.

avatar_overlays.name: Avatar Overlays
avatar_overlays.button_description: Make avatar overlay assets that can be used in video projects.
avatar_overlays.help: Avatar Overlays are small videos that can be used in larger video projects. Each separate overlay has a ring that glows when that person talks. Each overlay is 160x160 and does not include audio. Webapp users will have the default Discord avatar.
avatar_overlays.transparency_mkv: MPEG-4 does not support transparency, so both a static PNG image and an MKV representing the alpha (transparency) channel will be sent. Most video editors can be instructed to use one file for color and another file for alpha (transparency).
avatar_overlays.transparency_webm: WebM supports transparency, but most video editors do not support WebM.

exclude_user.name: Exclude Users
exclude_user.all_excluded_warning: At least one user should be included.
exclude_user.all_excluded_normalization_warning: If you want to exclude everyone from normalization, just turn normalization off!

minizel.title: In-Browser Processing
minizel.mix_description: This will download and process the raw recording data in your browser, mixing all tracks into a single audio file.
minizel.multi_description: This will download and process the raw recording data in your browser, creating a separate audio file for each user.
minizel.download_pause_warning: The download may temporarily pause to wait for processing.
minizel.complete_message: Your audio files have been saved successfully!
minizel.error_message: An error occurred while processing your recording.

job.queued_description: Your recording has been queued to be processed…
job.download_complete: Your download has finished processing and should prompt to download shortly! If you did not get prompted to download your recording, click the "Download" button below.
job.too_many_connections: Too many users are viewing this recording right now. Live updates are disabled and updates may take longer to show up.
job.polling_warning: Changes to this process may not be immediate as there are too many users viewing it.

generic.duration: An issue occurred when trying to get the duration of the recording, try again later.

errors.unknown: An unknown error occurred, try again later.
errors.server_error: A server error occurred, try again later.
errors.invalid_body: We sent an invalid request to the server, you probably shouldn't see this. Reload the page if this issue persists.
errors.invalid_rec: The given recording ID is invalid.
errors.no_rec: The recording was not found, or the recording has expired.
errors.rec_no_data: This recording has no data and may have been deleted manually.
errors.recording_deleted: This recording was manually deleted on {deletedAt, date, all}.
errors.kitchen_down: The processing service is unavailable or down for maintenance. Try again later.
errors.job_exists: A processing task already exists for this recording.
errors.no_job: This recording currently does not have a running processing task.
errors.feature_unavailable: You requested to use a feature that can't be used on this recording.
errors.no_tracks_given: At least one track should be able to be processed.
errors.invalid_delete_key: The given delete key was invalid.

footer.beta: This is a beta version of the new download page! Join the {support_server} to report issues.

survey.text: Please take this quick survey and give some feedback about Craig.
